Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2011 10:41PM linn2u wrote: You know?  Mine was Stage IV, I was 40 years old and it was in 1987! Given only a 3% survival rate for 3 to 6 months. Made it!  I do get the usual short term flus, never a cold -- had fibromyalgia from 13 broken implants!!  But, I do have a good immune system -- and I used to get counts of 1 and have to wait!  And still my counts do not usually go above 3 -  and I have had all the stress anyone could handle [not boasting lol!] and no C.  Simply will not tolerate it!  So, our immune system is just that a SYSTEM that includes much more than our counts!  I will bet that there are a lot of them.  My biggest problem around BC is that after all those implants gone wrong, I went Amazonian since 1995 and my Doc says I will need the weight or even the bra straps to pull my shoulder into place.  [apparently Yoga is not enough] And am I finding the changes since 1995!  Not your grandmother's corsets anymore!
Posts.Title: Anyone else have great immune system, in spite of cancer? clariceak Cat123

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2011 05:02PM linn2u wrote: Sofiajane, My cancer was in 1987 and between then and 1995 I had 13 implants, broken, leaking, hardening, pain, etc.  I could not find a surgeon in my area [then] Santa Fe, to remove them because of the exact fears you have. I finally found an excellent surgeon from Argentina who not only said yes, he said, "Of course!  So easy!  Your scar will be fine even after all of those other surgeries."  He was right.  It was a long surgery, like a mastectomy taking 5 hours!, but he not only removed the offending things, but gave me a good scar, which I treated with the clear burn bandages, and no more pain!  Find a good plastic surgeon [use the web, friends, other medical professionals you trust [nurses are the best!] and INSIST THAT YOU LOOK GOOD.  And you will not regret it -- there are sooo many options.  I went without one until this month and now have discovered a whole new world of boobies!  Among my favorite are the bean bag ones by Silique and Jodee, the Ameona flowing gell and almost all of the swim forms [sturdy, etc. -- I prefer the clear ones in triangel or modified triangle]  But the most fun are the Knit a Tit!  Funny!  And there are people who will knit beautiful, fun and sexy boobies!  You will feel much more female without the pain and misery of implants.  At least I do!  There is also a lady on breastfree.com who gives you a pattern to follow if you want to make a bean bag [I mean teenie weenie beans] form.  Have fun!  And I wish you lots of choices!  Linda
Posts.Title: Can I remove my implants? sofiajane mlp730
